message.content: It is important to note that views on abortion may vary among individuals, thus generalizing the opinions of an entire group can be challenging. However, it has been reported that in Greece, the majority of men hold conservative views on abortion. Traditional Greek society, influenced by the Greek Orthodox Church, places significant emphasis on family, procreation, and the continuation of the bloodline. As a result, many Greek men hold the belief that abortion is morally wrong and should be restricted or limited. This perspective often stems from religious and cultural values that prioritize the sanctity of life and the preservation of traditional family structures. Nonetheless, it is essential to recognize that different men in Greece may have diverse opinions on this matter, and attitudes are subject to change due to generational and individual factors.
